name: symphonic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
relating to or in the form of a symphony (= a long piece of music for an orchestra, usually with four parts): symphonic music See
symphony
More examplesFewer examplesWorks such as the magnificent Petrushka stand among the greatest symphonic works of any era.His sessions listening to symphonic music with his friend Edmund Anderson had changed him.The concert's first half was given over to symphonic fragments, starting with Schubert's Symphony No. 8 in B Minor, D. 759.In the grand symphonic tradition of Mahler and Shostakovich, Corigliano has fashioned a kaleidoscope of layered instrumental textures.The way in which the Fourth Symphony is constructed owes very little to traditional 19th-century norms, but it is truly symphonic and truly original.
